question: 圧倒する
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>pressure</kanji> used easily <kanji>collapse</kanji>s whatever it's pushing against. That's why this verb means <vocabulary>to overwhelm</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. Note that the <ja>あつ</ja> goes to <ja>あっ</ja>, as you'd probably expect.
